did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Honduran Subject Collection,

physdesc.label: Collection Size
physdesc.extent: 2 manuscript boxes, 1 oversize box, 1 videotape cassette, 2 phonorecords

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the online catalog.
did.abstract: Pamplets, reports, speeches, leaflets, flyers, serial issues, other printed matter, audio-visual material, relating to political conditions, elections, and civil rights in Honduras.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Honduran Subject Collection, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

did.unittitle: Subject File, 1977-1991.

scopecontent.p: Position papers, reports, letters, printed material, speeches, leaflets, electoral material, newsletters, and miscellany

did.unittitle: Oversize File, 1989
Audiovisual File, 1963-ca. 1989.

scopecontent.p: Two phonorecords and one cabinet videotape cassette entitled "A Review of the First Sentence Tape ('of the Corte Interamericano de Derechos Humanos') against a cabinet State (Honduras) for the Crime of Forced Disappearances," produced by ACAFADE (Asociacion Centroamericano Familiares de Detenidos Desaparecidos)

did.unittitle: SUBJECT FILE, 1977-1991

General. Serial issues, miscellany, letters, clipping, bulletins, pamphlets, reports, congress proceedings, flyers, cartoons, and position statements, 1977-1991. Includes material relating to university and labor unions, political parties, and relations with the United States
Elections
1985. Statutes, postion statements, pamphlets, reports, speech, leaflets, biographical material, and miscellany, 1983-1985
1989. Position statements, report and miscellany, 1989-1990
Federacion Unitaria de Trabajadores de Honduras. Position papers, letters, and newsletters, 1985-1987
Fuerza Universitaria Revolucionaria. Flyers, newsletters, report, and miscellany, 1984-1987
Human rights. Reports, charts, flyers, serial issues, clippings, 1980-1989. Includes material relating to refugees and to the Comite para la Defensa de los Derechos Humanos en Honduras (CODEH)
United States. Reports on United States military activity and foreign policy concerning Honduras, 1987
OVERSIZE FILE, 1989.
Oversize File, 1989. Poem and electoral platform
AUDIOVISUAL FILE, ca. 1963-1987
Phonorecords of political campaign songs
"Bu Giron Presidente," performed by Mariachi Nacional, 45 r.p.m..
"Viva Oscar Mejia Arelliano" and "Partido Liberal," 45 r.p.m.

One videotape cassette entitled "A Review of the First Sentence ('of the Corte Interamericano de Derechos Humanos') against a State (Honduras) for the Crime of Forced Disappearances," produced by ACAFADE (Asociacion Centroamericano Familiares de Detenidos Desaparecidos)
